subject: Sales
title: Jeff Bezos and One-Click Buying
description: A tiny lesson with a big payoff: Jeff Bezos and One-Click Buying.

hook.text: Amazon's one-click button killed every barrier between desire and purchase. One tap. Done.

buildup.text: Bezos understood that each extra checkout step kills sales. Friction is the enemy of revenue.

discovery.text: He patented one-click in 1999. Competitors had to license it or lose sales to extra steps.

twist.text: One-click wasn't just a feature. It was a philosophy: reduce friction everywhere, forever.

climax.text: That philosophy made Amazon the world's dominant retailer. Ease beats everything else.

punchline.text: He removed every step between wanting and having.

quiz.question: Why was one-click buying so revolutionary?
options: It removed friction from the buying process
